alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Mainland Northern Brevard; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:34PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Seminole, northwestern Brevard and southeastern Volusia Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 233 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Helen. This storm was nearly stationary. Additional strong storms were developing near Lake Ashby and near Lake Harney and Geneva. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Port Orange, Titusville, Oviedo and DeLand. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning will occur with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Mainland Northern Brevard; Seminole
